medical_history.chief_complaint: Severe hypoglycemia in two infants with undetectable cortisol and low growth hormone levels.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: In patient 1, hypoglycemia was first noted at 4 weeks of age, following initial presentation with jaundice and failure to thrive. Symptoms progressed with recurrent vomiting and significant weight loss. In patient 2, hypoglycemia was first noted at 1 day of age, initially treated but recurring despite glucocorticoid therapy, with associated hypotonia and poor feeding.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Patient 1: Complicated by hypertension during pregnancy; patient 2: Complicated by pneumothorax and atrial septal defect during the first week of life. Both patients exhibited severe cortisol deficiency and low GH levels during hypoglycemic episodes.
medical_history.family_history: Patient 1: Non-consanguineous parents; Patient 2: Remotely consanguineous parents with two healthy older brothers.
